Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Did da Vinci actually leave hidden clues in his paintings? Is there indeed a secret society protecting the bloodline of Christ? Join our team of real-life code breakers, Renaissance experts, and professors of religion and language as we uncover the truth behind this controversial film.

Clip.Title: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.Episode: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: It's an incredible story of treasures saved, and hope restored. In the aftermath of the devastating 2010 earthquake in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, a cultural recovery project is born. The Smithsonian Institution, in collaboration with the Haitian government, embark on a mission to restore thousands of damaged artworks gathered from the ruins of public museums, private galleries, and toppled cathedrals.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The vaults and labs of the Smithsonian feature fascinating stories about "the birds and the bees." From public health concerns, to shifting societal norms, to the complex mating habits found in the wild, join host Tom Cavanagh as he goes behind the scenes of the Smithsonian to find evidence of romance and yes, sex.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: join host Tom Cavanagh (from TV's "Ed") as we explore the crime "scene" at the Smithsonian's Vaults: photographic evidence from the Crime of the Century; everyone's favorite natural villain, the snake; and America's first "Lone Gunman": John Wilkes Booth.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From St. John's heading north, the Newfoundland coastline is a maze of iconic bays and inlets - from world-famous Fogo Island, to the abandoned fishing settlements along the island's Northern peninsula.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the remote Northern Shore of Nova Scotia, to the red mud perimetre of Prince Edward Island, the warm waters of the Northumberland Strait are the setting for an incredible aerial exploration of these coastlines.

The Smithsonian Institution, in collaboration with the Haitian government, embark on a mission to restore thousands of damaged artworks gathered from the ruins of public museums, private galleries, and toppled cathedrals.

Clip.Title: PUTIN'S KISS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Nineteen-year-old Masha is the spokesperson of Nashi, a popular political youth organization with direct ties to The Kremlin. However, after she starts socializing with members of the opposition, which are the considered the enemy, Masha realizes she must make a stand and choose.

Clip.Title: VLAST (POWER)
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A documentary about the fallen oligarch Mikhail Khodorkovsky...a tale of Russian oil, politics and intrigue.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.Episode: France: Blue Tears of a Glacier
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In the Alps, the climatic change effects are 3 times higher than the world average. The changes in the weather (more rain and less snow) are leading to natural risks as avalanche, floods, and collapse.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Small pockets of people begin to eke out an environmentally-sustainable way of life in America.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join the Bionic Vet and his staff as they tend to a puppy in shock, a police dog in agony and a cat about to take her first (reluctant) dip into the center's hydrotherapy pool.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: One thousand miles off the southeast coast of Argentina sits the sub-Antarctic island of South Georgia in the Southern Ocean. About the size of Rhode Island, it's a breathtaking sight - long and narrow - shaped like a huge fractured whalebone. Massive glaciers, ice caps and snowfields cover about 75% of the island, but the land is far from desolate

Clip.Title: SPIRITS OF ORCHID ISLAND
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Tao people of this Indo-Pacific island share their stirling example of how to sustain one's environment.

Clip.Title: SOUTH SEA PEARLS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Enter a secretive world of pearl farmers of the Tropical Western Pacific, or the South Seas. Beneath these clear waters, divers risk their lives to puruse a miraculous gem.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join the Bionic Vet and his staff as they tend to a puppy in shock, a police dog in agony and a cat about to take her first (reluctant) dip into the center's hydrotherapy pool.
